intro: Buddleja scordioides, commonly known as the Ethiopian butterfly bush, is a shrub native to Ethiopia. It features showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, grayish pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Buddleja scordioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native gardens.
